intro: Saussurea kubotae var. yuparensis, commonly known as the Yuparensis Saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of northern South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and yellowish-green flowering heads. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
